channel.title: NPR Topics: Culture
channel.description: Art and entertainment commentary plus interviews, book reviews, movie reviews, music reviews, comedy, and visual art. Subscribe to podcasts and follow trends in music, painting, art, architecture, photography, and design.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: What Stranger Things gets right about wormholes
item.description: The final episode of fifth season of the Netflix series Stranger Things is out this week, and the concept of a wormhole figures largely into it. While the show is a work of fiction, theoretical wormholes have making appearances for decades not only in science fiction but in actual science.
item.content:encoded:
The final episode of fifth season of the Netflix series Stranger Things is out this week, and the concept of a wormhole figures largely into it. While the show is a work of fiction, theoretical wormholes have making appearances for decades not only in science fiction but in actual science.

(Image credit: KTSDESIGN)
item.dc:creator: Katia Riddle

item.title: Out with the mayo: How Ukrainians reclaim holiday food
item.description: For many people from former Soviet countries, New Year's is a big holiday feast time. A Ukrainian restaurant in Washington gives NPR a taste of what's on the menu.
item.content:encoded:
For many people from former Soviet countries, New Year's is a big holiday feast time. A Ukrainian restaurant in Washington gives NPR a taste of what's on the menu.

(Image credit: Samantha Balaban/NPR)
item.dc:creator: Daniel Estrin

item.title: 50 wonderful things from 2025
item.description: Each year, critic Linda Holmes looks back on the year and compiles a list of the things that brought her joy.
item.content:encoded:
'/>

Each year, critic Linda Holmes looks back on the year and compiles a list of the things that brought her joy.

(Image credit: HBO Max, Netflix, Sony Pictures Classics, Netflix, Netflix, A24)
item.dc:creator: Linda Holmes

item.title: Why do we make New Year's resolutions? A brief history of a long tradition
item.description: One of the earliest mentions of New Year's resolutions appeared in a Boston newspaper in 1813. But the practice itself can be traced back to the Babylonians.
item.content:encoded:
One of the earliest mentions of New Year's resolutions appeared in a Boston newspaper in 1813. But the practice itself can be traced back to the Babylonians.

(Image credit: Atsushi Tsukada)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: Remembering the actors, musicians, writers and artists we lost in 2025
item.description: Every year, we remember some of the writers, actors, musicians, filmmakers and performers who died over the past year, and whose lifetime of creative work helped shape our world.
item.content:encoded: Every year, we remember some of the writers, actors, musicians, filmmakers and performers who died over the past year, and whose lifetime of creative work helped shape our world.
item.dc:creator: Neda Ulaby

item.title: Remembering the jazz greats we lost in 2025
item.description: Critic Kevin Whitehead reflects on the jazz notables who died this year, including Sheila Jordan, Andy Bey, Ray Drummond, Bunky Green, Chuck Mangione, Eddie Palmieri and Jim McNeely.
item.content:encoded: Critic Kevin Whitehead reflects on the jazz notables who died this year, including Sheila Jordan, Andy Bey, Ray Drummond, Bunky Green, Chuck Mangione, Eddie Palmieri and Jim McNeely.
item.dc:creator: Kevin Whitehead

item.title: Richard Kind plays to the largest audience of his life in 'Everybody's Live'
item.description: Kind is the announcer and host sidekick on the Netflix show Everybody's Live with John Mulaney. "You must understand — it's anarchy," he says of the show. Originally broadcast April 4, 2025.
item.content:encoded: Kind is the announcer and host sidekick on the Netflix show Everybody's Live with John Mulaney. "You must understand — it's anarchy," he says of the show. Originally broadcast April 4, 2025.
item.dc:creator: Terry Gross

item.title: Isiah Whitlock Jr., actor from 'The Wire,' 'Veep' and Spike Lee films, dies at 71
item.description: Actor Isiah Whitlock Jr. has died at age 71. Whitlock played the corrupt state Sen. Clay Davis on "The Wire." He also appeared in several Spike Lee films, including "25th Hour" and "BlacKkKlansman."
item.content:encoded:
Actor Isiah Whitlock Jr. has died at age 71. Whitlock played the corrupt state Sen. Clay Davis on "The Wire." He also appeared in several Spike Lee films, including "25th Hour" and "BlacKkKlansman."

(Image credit: CJ Rivera)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Kennedy Center renaming prompts a new round of cancellations
item.description: The Kennedy Center is ending the year with a new round of artists saying they are canceling scheduled performances after President Donald Trump's name was added to the facility.
item.content:encoded:
The Kennedy Center is ending the year with a new round of artists saying they are canceling scheduled performances after President Donald Trump's name was added to the facility.

(Image credit: Julia Demaree Nikhinson/AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Promoting a movie in 2025 is a performance in itself
item.description: NPR's Scott Detrow speaks with Nicholas Quah of Vulture about the evolution of celebrity publicity as the "new media circuit" commands more attention.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Scott Detrow speaks with Nicholas Quah of Vulture about the evolution of celebrity publicity as the "new media circuit" commands more attention.
item.dc:creator: Scott Detrow
